Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Implements a read-only base interface for the class. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interfaces implement the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface; so all properties and methods of that interface are implied here. You can use this type of interface for read-only field collections. For example, the application can retrieve the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.AllFields%2A> property, which is a combined collection of explicitly defined and automatically generated fields for the control. However, the application cannot add or remove fields in this collection.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

Docs.summary: Returns an array of all the items in the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: An array of all the items in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 IndexOf(string fieldIDOrTitle) cil managed

Docs.param: A string to compare with the or property.
Docs.summary: Returns the index of a field. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: The index of the specified field.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the second version of this method, it searches for a field with the `Title` property `fieldId` and returns the first matching field. If no match is found, it searches for a field with the `DataField` property's `fieldID` parameter and returns the first matching field. Otherwise, it returns `-1`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the first version of this method, it returns the index of the specified field. If the specified field is not in the collection, it returns `-1`.

Docs.param: The index of the item to retrieve from the collection.
